page.description: Used to create a filter for listing tables in a database.

property.name: IncludeAllCatalogs
property.description: include all catalogs. Default value is .f.

property.name: IncludeAllOwners
property.description: Inlcude all owners. Default value is .f.

property.name: IncludeAllSchemas
property.description: Include all schemas. Default value is .t.

property.name: IncludeLinkedTables
property.description: Include linked tables. Default value is .f.

property.name: IncludeSystemTables
property.description: Include system tables. Default value is .f.

property.name: MaximumTablesInList
property.description: Maximum number of tables to list. Default value is 1000.

page.example:
dim sqlFilter as sql::TableFilter sqlFilter.IncludeAliases= .t. sqlFilter.IncludeAllCatalogs= .F. sqlFilter.IncludeAllOwners= .F. sqlFilter.IncludeAllSchemas= .T. sqlFilter.IncludeLinkedTables= .f. sqlFilter.IncludeSynonyms= .t. sqlFilter.IncludeSystemTables= .f. sqlFilter.IncludeTables= .t. sqlFilter.IncludeViews= .t. sqlfilter.MaximumTablesInList = 2000
dim cn as sql::connection cn.open("::name::myconnection")
dim list as c list = cn.listTables(sqlFilter)
